summary_variants.short_answer: Vaccination introduces an antigen or genetic blueprint to train the immune system to prevent or lessen infectious disease.
summary_variants.kid_friendly: Vaccines teach your body how to fight germs before you get really sick.
summary_variants.standard: Vaccination is a biomedical intervention that stimulates adaptive immunity by exposing the body to antigens or antigen-encoding material. It primes B and T cells, enabling faster and stronger responses upon real infection and is a cornerstone of public health.
summary_variants.expert_notes: Cover antigen designs (live-attenuated, inactivated, mRNA, vector-based), herd immunity thresholds, safety surveillance (VAERS, VSD), and cold-chain logistics.

slots.definition: The administration of antigenic material to induce protective immunity against a pathogen.
key_characteristics: Relies on humoral and cellular immune memory
Diverse platforms: live attenuated, inactivated, subunit, conjugate, mRNA, viral vector
Requires dosing schedules and boosters for sustained protection
history: Rapid mRNA vaccine deployment during COVID-19 (2020)

evidence.title: General Best Practice Guidelines for Immunization
